title: Orbital energy - launch speed to escape velocity

content.question: A rock is launched with initial speed <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> perpendicularly away from the surface of a non-rotating planet that has no atmosphere. The graph shows the speed of the rock as a function of the rockâ€™s distance from the surface of the planet. The speed of the rock asymptotically approaches the dashed line. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> to the magnitude of the escape velocity <math alttext="v sub e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>e</mi></msub></math> of the rock from the surface of the planet, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub 0 equals v sub e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>e</mi></msub></math> because the graph reaches a horizontal asymptote.

<math alttext="v sub 0 equals v sub e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>e</mi></msub></math> because the rock escapes the gravitational pull of the planet.

<math alttext="v sub 0 is greater than v sub e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>e</mi></msub></math> because the slope of the graph becomes less negative with increasing distance.

<math alttext="v sub 0 is greater than v sub e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>e</mi></msub></math> because the rock will have nonzero kinetic energy when it is very far from the planet.

content.answer: <math alttext="v sub 0 is greater than v sub e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>e</mi></msub></math> because the rock will have nonzero kinetic energy when it is very far from the planet.
